security_audit.summary: This skill consists of a single SKILL.md documentation file with no executable code. The file describes PR creation workflows and templates but contains no scripts, network calls, file operations, or command execution capabilities. All git/gh commands mentioned are documentation only, not actual code.

content.value_statement: Manually creating pull requests wastes time and risks inconsistent formatting. This skill automates PR creation for specification and implementation reviews with proper templates, title conventions, and user confirmation before execution.
actual_capabilities: Creates PRs with proper title prefixes (spec: or impl:)
Commits pending changes before PR creation
Validates tests pass before creating implementation PRs
Prompts for user confirmation before final execution
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Cannot create PRs for already merged branches
User must confirm each PR creation step

use_cases.title: Automated spec review PRs
use_cases.description: Automatically create PRs when specification drafting completes with proper review checklists

use_cases.title: Implementation review PRs
use_cases.description: Generate standardized implementation PRs after completing all AC-verified tasks

use_cases.title: Consistent PR documentation
use_cases.description: Ensure every PR includes summary, test plan, and AC confirmation fields

best_practices: Always confirm PR details before approval to catch errors early
Use consistent title prefixes to distinguish spec from implementation PRs
Run tests locally before creating implementation PRs to avoid CI failures
anti_patterns: Skipping user confirmation step when in a hurry
Creating PRs without verifying tests pass first
Using inconsistent naming conventions across different PRs

faq.question: What tools are required for this skill?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI (gh) must be installed and authenticated with gh auth login before use.

faq.question: Can I create PRs for non-GitHub repositories?
faq.answer: No, this skill specifically uses gh pr create and is designed for GitHub repositories only.

faq.question: What happens if tests are failing?
faq.answer: For implementation PRs, the skill warns about tests not passing but still allows PR creation after user confirmation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads git status locally and uses gh CLI to create PRs. No data is sent to external servers beyond normal GitHub API calls.

faq.question: What if a PR already exists for my branch?
faq.answer: The skill detects existing PRs and offers options to update the existing PR or create a new one.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub's default PR creation?
faq.answer: This skill enforces SDD conventions with proper templates, title formats, and AC checklists that GitHub's default PR flow does not provide.
